document.masterDocTitle: Syllinae (Polychaeta, Syllidae) from Australia. Part. 2. Genera Inermosyllis, Megasyllis n. gen., Opisthosyllis, and Trypanosyllis

heading.emphasis:
Key to the Australian species of
Trypanosyllis

paragraph.keyLead:
1. Body usually strongly pigmented, with two transversal pink to red bands on each anterior segment. Compound chaetae distinctly bidentate, with a marked dorso-ventral gradation in length of blades................... ......................................................................................................................................
Trypanosyllis zebra

- Body without a colour pattern. Compound chaetae bidentate, with small proximal tooth, almost unidentate; blades all similar in length ...................................................................................
Trypanosyllis aeolis
